description.narrative: Supporting improvements in public financial management (PFM) has been a key element of Australia’s bilateral aid program in Afghanistan since 2012. It was originally delivered by International Relief and Development (IRD) as part of the third phase of the Development Assistance Facility for Afghanistan (DAFA III). With the closure of this facility, programming was novated to be directly implemented by IRD until its original end date of 30 September 2015. The PFM program is helping strengthen national budget management, procurement and financial administration processes in Afghanistan, and has been highly successful in delivering results. The total value of this initiative is $7.5 million over 2 years, starting 2014-15.
